intro: Canthium manambyanum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats and is known for its latex-containing sap. Canthium manambyanum is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
